alert.note: Alert for Carroll; Haralson; Heard (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 6:33AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Haralson, Carroll and northwestern Heard Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 631 AM EDT, a line of strong thunderstorms was along a line extending from near Sweetwater Lake to near Hollis Crossroads to Lineville, and moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Carrollton, Bremen, Temple, Tallapoosa, Bowdon, Mount Zion, Waco, Ephesus, Centralhatchee, Roopville, Bowdon Junction, Tyus, Roosterville, Seaton Lake, Clem, Frolona, Abilene, John Tanner State Park, Lowell, and Blackjack Mountain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
